title: Poland: Citi Handlowy Named in the RESPECT Index for the Fifth Consecutive Year
summary: Warsaw - Citi Handlowy has been included in the RESPECT Index for the fifth consecutive time and has appeared in each edition since it was launched by the Warsaw Stock Exchange. It is one of only two banks that has been part of the index (which includes just 19 companies) since inception. This year, the index has seen one newcomer, JSW S.A.
tag-1: Poland: Citi Handlowy Named in the RESPECT Index for the Fifth Consecutive Year
tag-2: Warsaw – Citi Handlowy has been included in the RESPECT Index for the fifth consecutive time and has appeared in each edition since it was launched by the Warsaw Stock Exchange. It is one of only two banks that has been part of the index (which includes just 19 companies) since inception. This year, the index has seen one newcomer, JSW S.A.
tag-3: Companies that want to be selected for the RESPECT Index need to demonstrate high management standards in the area of corporate governance, information policy and investor relations and should also fulfill certain ecological, corporate social responsibility and employee-related criteria.
tag-4: A comprehensive approach to corporate social responsibility is an integral part of business strategy at Citi Handlowy, which is a leader in the workplace volunteerism movement – within the framework of activities co-ordinated by the Kronenberg Foundation.
tag-5: In seven years, volunteers from the bank have been involved in various works to benefit the needy over 10,000 times, completing 892 projects, benefiting more than 120,000 people throughout Poland.
tag-6: "The RESPECT Index reminds us that there is a place for values in business and, what is more, values are meaningful even in a purely financial environment such as the floor of the stock market," said Katarzyna Otko-Dabrowska, Head of the Strategic Projects & Investor Relations Team at Citi Handlowy. "I am proud to be chosen to receive this award on behalf of the bank, continuing the tradition of Poland's oldest commercial bank in that field."
tag-7: The RESPECT Index is the first index in Central & Eastern Europe compiled of companies that strive to abide by corporate social responsibility principles. Its aim is to select companies that are managed in a responsible & sustainable manner, but are also attractive investments. After verifying if the adopted requirements are met, the RESPECT Index, in each edition, contains only those of the listed companies that operate in accordance with the best management standards in the area of corporate governance, information policy and investor relations, and also meet certain ecological, corporate social responsibility and employee-related factors. As the eligibility criteria also include a liquidity factor, the RESPECT Index is a real reference for professional investors, similarly to other stock market indices. The analysis covers companies listed on the Warsaw Stock Exchange, with the exclusion of companies listed in the NewConnect market, foreign companies and companies in dual listing.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-9: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://blog.citigroup.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi
tag-10: Citi Handlowy Citi Handlowy is one of the major financial institutions in Poland and offers, under the Citi Handlowy brand, a broad range of state-of-the-art products in corporate, investment and consumer banking. Through its modern distribution channels and a network of over 149 branches, Bank Handlowy services 20,000 corporate customers and 965,000 individual ones. The Bank's group includes Dom Maklerski Banku Handlowego (brokerage house) and Handlowy Leasing. Being a member of Citi enables the customers of Bank Handlowy access to financial services provided in over 100 countries. Further information is available at www.citihandlowy.pl.
